subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Hindu Nationalism: Religion and Indian Identity
description: A quick win: understand Hindu Nationalism: Religion and Indian Identity.

hook.text: India is the world's largest democracy and a Hindu-majority nation. Mixing those two facts creates tension and violence.

buildup.text: Hindutva, or Hindu nationalism, argues India is a Hindu civilization. Muslims and Christians are outsiders in this view.

discovery.text: The BJP party rose to power on Hindutva ideology. It has rewritten textbooks, renamed cities, and restricted minorities.

twist.text: Gandhi, a devout Hindu, opposed Hindu nationalism. He was killed by one. India's father died for tolerance.

climax.text: India shows that even ancient, tolerant religions can become weapons of exclusion when mixed with political ambition.

punchline.text: Hindu nationalism turns tolerance into exclusion. Gandhi opposed it and died.

quiz.question: What is Hindutva?
options: A political ideology that defines India as a Hindu nation, marginalizing minorities
